actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term for President and Vice President, and to repeal the twenty-second article of amendment to the Constitution.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - States that the President and the Vice President shall hold office for a term of six years. Prohibits election more than once for either office. Prohibits a person who has been elected to the office of President from being elected to the office of Vice President. Repeals the 22d Amendment to the Constitution.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term for President and Vice President, and to repeal the twenty-second article of amendment to the Constitution.
